jobs

Class MandelbrotSetJob

  • java.lang.Object
    • jobs.MandelbrotSetJob
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Job<int[][]>

    public class MandelbrotSetJob
extends java.lang.Object
implements Job<int[][]>
    This class helps to produce a visualization of the some part of the Mandelbrot set which is probably one of the most well known fractals, and probably one of the most widely implemented fractal in fractal plotting programs.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int NUM_ROWS_PER_TASK
      The constant represents the number of rows that each task gets to process

      • NUM_ROWS_PER_TASK

        public static final int NUM_ROWS_PER_TASK
        The constant represents the number of rows that each task gets to process
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • MandelbrotSetJob

        public MandelbrotSetJob(double[] leftCornerCoordinates,
                double edgeLength,
                int numSquares,
                int iterationLimit)
        Instantiates a new Mandelbrot set task.
        Parameters:
        leftCornerCoordinates - the left corner coordinates of the square in the complex plane
        edgeLength - the edge length of the square in the complex plane
        numSquares - the number denoting the number of pixels (n x n squares) inside the square region in the complex plane
        iterationLimit - the iteration limit that denotes the number of iterations to do before deciding that the representative point of a region is considered to be in the Mandelbrot set

    • Method Detail

      • generateTasks

        public void generateTasks(Space space)
        Generates multiple tasks from this job. The client decomposes the problem (job), constructing a set of Task objects The MandelbrotSet job is decomposed into 'n' number of tasks, with each task taking care of a fixed number of rows as defined by NUM_ROWS_PER_TASK
        Specified by:
        generateTasks in interface Job<int[][]>
        Parameters:
        space - the space

      • collectResults

        public int[][] collectResults(Space space)
        Collects results from the Space, composing them into a solution to the original problem. Each result in the MandelbrotSet job is a one-dimensional array that contains the 'k' values of multiple rows (which correspond to the number of rows that each task works upon)
        Specified by:
        collectResults in interface Job<int[][]>
        Parameters:
        space - the space
        Returns:
        t
